intro: Palicourea heydei, commonly known as the golden star or sweetleaf, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruits are small, green berries that turn red when ripe, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Palicourea heydei is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
